articles.headline: Israel Said to Be Source of Secret Intelligence Trump Gave to Russians
articles.snippet: The revelation adds a potential diplomatic complication to an episode that has renewed questions about how the White House handles sensitive intelligence.
articles.abstract: The revelation adds a potential diplomatic complication to an episode that has renewed questions about how the White House handles sensitive intelligence.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The classified intelligence that President Trump disclosed in a meeting last week with Russian officials at the White House was provided by Israel, according to a current and a former American official familiar with how the United States obtained the information. The revelation adds a potential diplomatic complication to an episode that has renewed questions about how the White House handles sensitive intelligence.
articles.byline: By Adam Goldman, Eric Schmitt and Peter Baker

articles.headline: Remaking Baltimore’s Waterfront, With a Splash of Whiskey
articles.snippet: With the help of a horse farm once owned by a Vanderbilt, the Under Armour founder Kevin Plank is restoring luster to Maryland traditions and landmarks.
articles.abstract: With the help of a horse farm once owned by a Vanderbilt, the Under Armour founder Kevin Plank is restoring luster to Maryland traditions and landmarks.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Rising high above the new Sagamore Spirit distillery in South Baltimore is a white water tower with three maroon diamonds on each side, a nod to the jockey silks of the thoroughbred farm that provides the spring water for the company’s rye whiskey.

articles.headline: Comey Memo Says Trump Asked Him to End Flynn Investigation
articles.snippet: “I hope you can let this go,” the president told the F.B.I. director in an Oval Office meeting in February, according to a memo James B. Comey wrote.
articles.abstract: “I hope you can let this go,” the president told the F.B.I. director in an Oval Office meeting in February, according to a memo James B. Comey wrote.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump asked the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, to shut down the federal investigation into Mr. Trump’s former national security adviser, Michael T. Flynn, in an Oval Office meeting in February, according to a memo Mr. Comey wrote shortly after the meeting.

articles.headline: ‘Vulnerable Voices’ Lash Out as Companies Sway Climate Talks
articles.snippet: Developing nations and environmental groups condemned the presence of corporate lobbyists at a climate change talk session in Germany, but the United States defended it.
articles.abstract: Developing nations and environmental groups condemned the presence of corporate lobbyists at a climate change talk session in Germany, but the United States defended it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Developing nations and environmental groups are challenging some of the world’s biggest companies and wealthiest countries over the role corporate lobbyists play in United Nations climate change negotiations.

articles.headline: Leading TBS and TNT Into the Fray of Great TV
articles.snippet: Kevin Reilly, a veteran network executive, aims to transform two cable networks that have come to be known for the repeats they carry.
articles.abstract: Kevin Reilly, a veteran network executive, aims to transform two cable networks that have come to be known for the repeats they carry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two and a half years ago, the cable channels TBS and TNT were going strong.

articles.headline: ESPN Is Betting on Big Personalities to Restore Its Fortunes
articles.snippet: ESPN, once the king of sports programming, now competes with companies that offer instant statistics and highlights, and, increasingly, games.
articles.abstract: ESPN, once the king of sports programming, now competes with companies that offer instant statistics and highlights, and, increasingly, games.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just weeks after ESPN laid off about 100 journalists and on-air commentators, the “Worldwide Leader in Sports” unveiled a new programming slate on Tuesday filled with big personalities but short on the kind of highlight shows that for many years were the foundation of the network.
articles.byline: By Sydney Ember and Brooks Barnes

articles.headline: Malware Case Is Major Blow for the N.S.A.
articles.snippet: The latest nightmare for the agency, which is responsible for eavesdropping, code breaking and cyberespionage, appears to be far from over.
articles.abstract: The latest nightmare for the agency, which is responsible for eavesdropping, code breaking and cyberespionage, appears to be far from over.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Since August, when a mysterious group calling itself the Shadow Brokers announced that it was auctioning off highly classified National Security Agency hacking tools, a low-grade panic has seized the nation’s largest intelligence agency.

articles.headline: Google, Not the Government, Is Building the Future
articles.snippet: Without greater federal funding of cutting-edge technologies, corporations such as Google will be the ones that own the future.
articles.abstract: Without greater federal funding of cutting-edge technologies, corporations such as Google will be the ones that own the future.
articles.lead_paragraph: One persistent criticism of Silicon Valley is that it no longer works on big, world-changing ideas. Every few months, a dumb start-up will make the news — most recently the one selling a $700 juicer — and folks outside the tech industry will begin singing I-told-you-sos.

articles.headline: How Uber and Waymo Ended Up Rivals in the Race for Driverless Cars
articles.snippet: Google was an early ally of Uber when it was a ride-hailing start-up. That relationship changed when both pursued self-driving technology in earnest.
articles.abstract: Google was an early ally of Uber when it was a ride-hailing start-up. That relationship changed when both pursued self-driving technology in earnest.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — At a technology conference in mid-2014, the Google co-founder Sergey Brin presented the company’s first prototype for a self-driving car. Watching in the audience was Travis Kalanick, chief executive of Uber, the ride-hailing start-up.

articles.headline: VW Engineers Wanted O.K. From the Top for Emissions Fraud, Documents Show
articles.snippet: The documents, along with the continuing criminal investigations in the United States and Germany, signal that the scandal is creeping closer to Volkswagen’s boardroom.
articles.abstract: The documents, along with the continuing criminal investigations in the United States and Germany, signal that the scandal is creeping closer to Volkswagen’s boardroom.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — Even after Volkswagen pleaded guilty to a nine-year conspiracy to dupe regulators and consumers, the carmaker has continued to insist that top executives played no role in the emissions fraud.

articles.headline: Ford Moves to Trim Its Ranks as Its Chief Faces a Test
articles.snippet: With Mark Fields under investor pressure, the automaker is shedding 1,400 salaried jobs in a step to balance cutbacks with technology investments.
articles.abstract: With Mark Fields under investor pressure, the automaker is shedding 1,400 salaried jobs in a step to balance cutbacks with technology investments.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — It was not long ago that Ford Motor was considered the healthiest of the Detroit automakers.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Neal E. Boudette

articles.headline: Drama in Washington Rattles Wall Street, and Stocks Dive
articles.snippet: Investors have shrugged off previous turmoil in the Trump administration, but not the latest episode.
articles.abstract: Investors have shrugged off previous turmoil in the Trump administration, but not the latest episode.
articles.lead_paragraph: Confidence in President Trump’s agenda to stoke economic growth was questioned Wednesday, as stocks tumbled and the dollar weakened.
articles.byline: By Kate Kelly and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Household Debt Makes a Comeback in the U.S.
articles.snippet: Nearly a decade after the 2008 credit bubble, Americans have accumulated a total of $12.7 trillion in debt — a new peak.
articles.abstract: Nearly a decade after the 2008 credit bubble, Americans have accumulated a total of $12.7 trillion in debt — a new peak.
articles.lead_paragraph: It took nearly a decade, but debt has made a comeback.
articles.byline: By Michael Corkery and Stacy Cowley
